p: Chromatographic peaks 8 (4.2 min) and 10 (4.43 min) with a precursor ion [M − H] − at m/ z 163.0391, which had the predicted molecular formula C 16H 17O 9 (mass error 0.2 ppm), could be coumaric acid isomers. Indeed, these two peaks had the same MS2 ion at m/ z 119.049, corresponding to the removal of a -CO 2 group from coumaric acid. The identification was further confirmed by comparing the MS2 fragmentation behavior and the retention time of a p-coumaric acid reference standard. Therefore, peak 8 was identified as m/o-coumaric acid and peak 10 as p-coumaric acid ( Figure S1p).
